name: 6-nitro-2-phenyl-3H-indol-3-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3395
Reason: 6-nitro-2-phenyl-3H-indol-3-one has a melting point of 120.0 degrees Celsius. The nitro group is a strong withdrawing group that introduces a significant dipole moment, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The indole ring itself has a melting point of -105.0 degrees Celsius, and the phenyl group adds approximately +20°C to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The total increase due to the nitro group and phenyl group is approximately +70°C.
